tags.name: typeOrInstance
tags.description: the type or instance to be intercepted

description.full:
A Scarlet interceptor that emits events.

Emited Events

  • before - emitted before interceptors are called
  • after - emitted after intercepted method
  • done - emitted after all interceptors and intercepted method called

Example:

Basic interceptor

Scarlet.intercept(someFunction)
       .using(someInterceptor);

Interceptor with events

Scarlet.intercept(someFunction)
        .on('before', beforeFunction)
        .on('after', afterFunction)
        .on('done', doneFunction);
description.summary: A Scarlet interceptor that emits events.
description.body:
Emited Events

  • before - emitted before interceptors are called
  • after - emitted after intercepted method
  • done - emitted after all interceptors and intercepted method called

Example:

Basic interceptor

Scarlet.intercept(someFunction)
       .using(someInterceptor);

Interceptor with events

Scarlet.intercept(someFunction)
        .on('before', beforeFunction)
        .on('after', afterFunction)
        .on('done', doneFunction);

tags.name: targetMethod
tags.description: the method to call when the type or instance is intercepted

tags.name: targetThisContext
tags.description: the reference to self/this to be used when calling the intercepotr
A reference to the current interceptor(self)

description.full:
Attach an interceptor to the type or instance. Can be chained with multiple using clauses

Example:

function AnyObject() {};
function interceptor1(proceed) { proceed();}
function interceptor2(proceed) { proceed();}

scarlet.intercept(AnyObject) 
        .using(interceptor1) //->indicates the first interceptor to be called
        .using(interceptor2); //->indicates the second interceptor to be called

//-> AnyObject will now have the two interceptors attached
description.summary: Attach an interceptor to the type or instance. Can be chained with multiple using clauses
description.body:
Example:

function AnyObject() {};
function interceptor1(proceed) { proceed();}
function interceptor2(proceed) { proceed();}

scarlet.intercept(AnyObject) 
        .using(interceptor1) //->indicates the first interceptor to be called
        .using(interceptor2); //->indicates the second interceptor to be called

//-> AnyObject will now have the two interceptors attached

tags.description: A reference to the function being intercepted

description.full:
Provides the type or instance with the added intercepters. This is needed when intercepting a function.

Example:

function AnyObject() {};

AnyObject = scarlet.intercept(AnyObject)
                    .using(interceptor)
                    .resolve();

//-> AnyObject will contain the **interceptor**
description.summary: Provides the type or instance with the added intercepters. This is needed when intercepting a function.
description.body:
Example:

function AnyObject() {};

AnyObject = scarlet.intercept(AnyObject)
                    .using(interceptor)
                    .resolve();

//-> AnyObject will contain the **interceptor**

description.full: The original arguments passed into the function being intercepted
description.summary: The original arguments passed into the function being intercepted

description.summary: The result of the method being intercepted

comments.code: self.result = null;

tags.description: of the result of the original method call

description.full: Calls the intercepted method
description.summary: Calls the intercepted method

tags.description: - optional array of plugins to load

description.full:
Creates a Scarlet Instance

Example:

Scarlet
    .intercept(someFunction)
    .using(someInterceptorFunction);
description.summary: Creates a Scarlet Instance
description.body:
Example:

Scarlet
    .intercept(someFunction)
    .using(someInterceptorFunction);

tags.name: typeOrInstance
tags.description: the type or instance to be intercepted

description.full:
Creates a Scarlet interceptor. All Scarlet interceptors are instances of EventEmitter.

Example:

Basic interceptor

Scarlet.intercept(someFunction);

interceptor with events

Scarlet.intercept(someFunction)
       .on('before', beforeFunction)
       .on('after', afterFunction)
       .on('done', doneFunction);
description.summary: Creates a Scarlet interceptor. All Scarlet interceptors are instances of EventEmitter.
description.body:
Example:

Basic interceptor

Scarlet.intercept(someFunction);

interceptor with events

Scarlet.intercept(someFunction)
       .on('before', beforeFunction)
       .on('after', afterFunction)
       .on('done', doneFunction);

tags.name: typeOrInstance
tags.description: the type or instance to be intercepted

description.full:
Creates a Asynchronous Scarlet interceptor. All Scarlet interceptors are instances of EventEmitter.

Example:

Given an asynchronous interceptor:

function asyncInterceptor(proceed){
    setTimeout(function(){
        //done with long task
        proceed
    },10);
}

Basic interceptor

Scarlet.interceptAsync(someFunction)
       .using(asyncInterceptor)

interceptor with events

Scarlet.intercept(someFunction)
       .using(asyncInterceptor)
       .on('before', beforeFunction)
       .on('after', afterFunction)
       .on('done', doneFunction);
description.summary: Creates a Asynchronous Scarlet interceptor. All Scarlet interceptors are instances of EventEmitter.
description.body:
Example:

Given an asynchronous interceptor:

function asyncInterceptor(proceed){
    setTimeout(function(){
        //done with long task
        proceed
    },10);
}

Basic interceptor

Scarlet.interceptAsync(someFunction)
       .using(asyncInterceptor)

interceptor with events

Scarlet.intercept(someFunction)
       .using(asyncInterceptor)
       .on('before', beforeFunction)
       .on('after', afterFunction)
       .on('done', doneFunction);

description.full:
loads a plugin

Example:

Scarlet.loadPlugin(someScarletPlugin);
description.summary: loads a plugin
description.body:
Example:

Scarlet.loadPlugin(someScarletPlugin);
